name: DeployUsingPowerShell
description: Execute PowerShell commands remotely on machine(s)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Environment Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the environment for deploying application.​

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally provide a comma separated list of machines to deploy the application to. It defaults to all the machines in the environment.

inputs.name: SourcePackage
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the application binaries. Variables like $(Build.Repository.LocalPath) can be used for binaries in the Automation Agent.

inputs.name: ApplicationPath
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local Path on the target machines for copying the binaries from the source.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: PowerShell Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell script on the local machine or on a UNC path

inputs.name: InitializationScriptPath
inputs.label: Initialization Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell initialization script (data script for DSC) on the local machine or on a UNC path.

inputs.name: AlternateCredentialsUsername
inputs.label: Alternate Credentials Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Username of the alternate credentials required to connect to the VSO service. See http://aka.ms/ALTCREDENTIALS for more information

inputs.name: AlternateCredentialsPassword
inputs.label: Alternate Credentials Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password of the alternate credentials required to connect to the VSO service. See http://aka.ms/ALTCREDENTIALS for more information
